alert.note: Alert for Dodge; Olmsted (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 10:30AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Olmsted and northeastern Dodge Counties through 1130 AM CDT... At 1030 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Kasson, or over Mantorville, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Mantorville and Kasson around 1035 AM CDT. Byron around 1055 AM CDT. Rochester around 1120 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Danesville, Highway 57 And 570th Street, Salem Corners, Highway 52 And County 14, Hidden Meadows R V Park, Wasioja, Kings Park, Douglas, Oxbow Park and Berne. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
